      23             : namespace mozilla {

      25             : typedef MozPromise<bool, bool, false> ShutdownPromise;
      26             : 
      27             : // Abstracts executing runnables in order on an arbitrary event target. The
      28             : // runnables dispatched to the TaskQueue will be executed in the order in which
      29             : // they're received, and are guaranteed to not be executed concurrently.
      30             : // They may be executed on different threads, and a memory barrier is used
      31             : // to make this threadsafe for objects that aren't already threadsafe.
      32             : //
      33             : // Note, since a TaskQueue can also be converted to an nsIEventTarget using
      34             : // WrapAsEventTarget() its possible to construct a hierarchy of TaskQueues.
      35             : // Consider these three TaskQueues:
      36             : //
      37             : //  TQ1 dispatches to the main thread
      38             : //  TQ2 dispatches to TQ1
      39             : //  TQ3 dispatches to TQ1
      40             : //
      41             : // This ensures there is only ever a single runnable from the entire chain on
      42             : // the main thread.  It also ensures that TQ2 and TQ3 only have a single runnable
      43             : // in TQ1 at any time.
      44             : //
      45             : // This arrangement lets you prioritize work by dispatching runnables directly
      46             : // to TQ1.  You can issue many runnables for important work.  Meanwhile the TQ2
      47             : // and TQ3 work will always execute at most one runnable and then yield.
      48             : class TaskQueue : public AbstractThread
      49             : {
      50             :   class EventTargetWrapper;
      51             : 
      52             : public:
      53             :   explicit TaskQueue(already_AddRefed<nsIEventTarget> aTarget,
      54             :                      bool aSupportsTailDispatch = false);
      55             : 
      56             :   TaskDispatcher& TailDispatcher() override;
      57             : 
      58           0 :   TaskQueue* AsTaskQueue() override { return this; }
      59             : 
      60           0 :   void Dispatch(already_AddRefed<nsIRunnable> aRunnable,
      61             :                 DispatchFailureHandling aFailureHandling = AssertDispatchSuccess,
      62             :                 DispatchReason aReason = NormalDispatch) override
      63             :   {
      64             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIRunnable> r = aRunnable;
      65             :     {
      66           0 :       MonitorAutoLock mon(mQueueMonitor);
      67           0 :       nsresult rv = DispatchLocked(/* passed by ref */r, aFailureHandling, aReason);
      68           0 :       MOZ_DIAGNOSTIC_ASSERT(aFailureHandling == DontAssertDispatchSuccess || NS_SUCCEEDED(rv));
      69           0 :       Unused << rv;
      70             :     }
      71             :     // If the ownership of |r| is not transferred in DispatchLocked() due to
      72             :     // dispatch failure, it will be deleted here outside the lock. We do so
      73             :     // since the destructor of the runnable might access TaskQueue and result
      74             :     // in deadlocks.
      75           0 :   }
      76             : 
      77             :   // Puts the queue in a shutdown state and returns immediately. The queue will
      78             :   // remain alive at least until all the events are drained, because the Runners
      79             :   // hold a strong reference to the task queue, and one of them is always held
      80             :   // by the target event queue when the task queue is non-empty.
      81             :   //
      82             :   // The returned promise is resolved when the queue goes empty.
      83             :   RefPtr<ShutdownPromise> BeginShutdown();
      84             : 
      85             :   // Blocks until all task finish executing.
      86             :   void AwaitIdle();
      87             : 
      88             :   // Blocks until the queue is flagged for shutdown and all tasks have finished
      89             :   // executing.
      90             :   void AwaitShutdownAndIdle();
      91             : 
      92             :   bool IsEmpty();
      93             :   uint32_t ImpreciseLengthForHeuristics();
      94             : 
      95             :   // Returns true if the current thread is currently running a Runnable in
      96             :   // the task queue.
      97             :   bool IsCurrentThreadIn() override;
      98             : 
      99             :   // Create a new nsIEventTarget wrapper object that dispatches to this
     100             :   // TaskQueue.
     101             :   already_AddRefed<nsIEventTarget> WrapAsEventTarget();
     102             : 
     103             : protected:
     104             :   virtual ~TaskQueue();
     105             : 
     106             : 
     107             :   // Blocks until all task finish executing. Called internally by methods
     108             :   // that need to wait until the task queue is idle.
     109             :   // mQueueMonitor must be held.
     110             :   void AwaitIdleLocked();
     111             : 
     112             :   nsresult DispatchLocked(nsCOMPtr<nsIRunnable>& aRunnable,
     113             :                           DispatchFailureHandling aFailureHandling,
     114             :                           DispatchReason aReason = NormalDispatch);
     115             : 
     116           0 :   void MaybeResolveShutdown()
     117             :   {
     118           0 :     mQueueMonitor.AssertCurrentThreadOwns();
     119           0 :     if (mIsShutdown && !mIsRunning) {
     120           0 :       mShutdownPromise.ResolveIfExists(true, __func__);
     121           0 :       mTarget = nullptr;
     122             :     }
     123           0 :   }
     124             : 
     125             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIEventTarget> mTarget;
     126             : 
     127             :   // Monitor that protects the queue and mIsRunning;
     128             :   Monitor mQueueMonitor;
     129             : 
     130             :   // Queue of tasks to run.
     131             :   std::queue<nsCOMPtr<nsIRunnable>> mTasks;
     132             : 
     133             :   // The thread currently running the task queue. We store a reference
     134             :   // to this so that IsCurrentThreadIn() can tell if the current thread
     135             :   // is the thread currently running in the task queue.
     136             :   //
     137             :   // This may be read on any thread, but may only be written on mRunningThread.
     138             :   // The thread can't die while we're running in it, and we only use it for
     139             :   // pointer-comparison with the current thread anyway - so we make it atomic
     140             :   // and don't refcount it.
     141             :   Atomic<nsIThread*> mRunningThread;
     142             : 
     143             :   // RAII class that gets instantiated for each dispatched task.
     144             :   class AutoTaskGuard : public AutoTaskDispatcher

     155             : 
     156           0 :       mLastCurrentThread = sCurrentThreadTLS.get();
     157             :       sCurrentThreadTLS.set(aQueue);
     158             : 
     159             :       MOZ_ASSERT(mQueue->mRunningThread == nullptr);
     160           0 :       mQueue->mRunningThread = NS_GetCurrentThread();
     161           0 :     }
     162             : 
     163           0 :     ~AutoTaskGuard()
     164           0 :     {
     165           0 :       DrainDirectTasks();
     166             : 
     167             :       MOZ_ASSERT(mQueue->mRunningThread == NS_GetCurrentThread());
     168           0 :       mQueue->mRunningThread = nullptr;
     169             : 
     170           0 :       sCurrentThreadTLS.set(mLastCurrentThread);
     171           0 :       mQueue->mTailDispatcher = nullptr;
     172           0 :     }
     173             : 
     174             :   private:
     175             :   TaskQueue* mQueue;
